cards.original_text: Nonartifact creatures get +2/+2 as long as they all share a color.

rulings.text: It really does mean "all creatures", including your opponent's.

The ability gives +2/+2 to all creatures which are not artifact creatures, as long as every one of those creatures is of the same color. They can have additional colors beyond the one they share, but they all have to share one color. If any creature is not of the shared color, the bonus is lost.

cards.name: Cornered Market

Players can't cast spells with the same name as a nontoken permanent.

Don't step on the livelihood of other vendors, or they may step on you.

cards.original_text: Players can't play spells or nonbasic lands with the same name as a card in play.

rulings.text: Cornered Market does not prevent effects which put a card onto the battlefield. It only stops people from casting.
This card only looks at permanents, not spells on the stack. So it is possible to cast two instances of a spell onto the stack.

Target spell with a single target targets another target instead.

rulings.text: Once the spell resolves, the new target is considered to be targeted by the deflected spell. This will trigger any effects which trigger on being targeted.
This only targets the spell being changed, not the original or new target of the spell it is affecting.
The target of a spell that targets another spell on the stack can be changed to any other spell on the stack, even if the new target will resolve before the spell does.
You can't make a spell which is on the stack target itself.

You can choose to make a spell on the stack target this spell (if such a target choice would be legal had the spell been cast while this spell was on the stack). The new target for the deflected spell is not chosen until this spell resolves. This spell is still on the stack when new targets are selected for the spell.
If there is no other legal target for the spell, this does not change the target.
This does not check if the current target is legal. It just checks if the spell has a single target.
You choose the spell to target on announcement, but you pick the new target for that spell on resolution.

cards.name: Conspiracy

cards.original_text:
As Conspiracy comes into play, choose a creature type.

rulings.text: It does not replace any use of creature types in card text.
This can grant a creature type to animated lands and artifacts that would otherwise have no creature type.
"Legend" is no longer a creature type, and may not be chosen.
If you choose Wall, then your creatures can still attack because creature types don't confer abilities such as defender (any more than, say, choosing creature type Bird would confer flying).
Affected spells, cards, and creatures lose all of their other creature types.

Replacement effects that modify creatures of a certain type as they enter the battlefield will apply (or not apply) after you apply this effect. For example, if Warrior is the chosen creature type and you control Bramblewood Paragon, a Runeclaw Bear would enter the battlefield with an additional +1/+1 counter.

cards.name: Thieves' Auction
cards.text: Exile all nontoken permanents. Starting with you, each player chooses one of the exiled cards and puts it onto the battlefield tapped under their control. Repeat this process until all cards exiled this way have been chosen.
cards.original_text: Set aside all permanents. You choose one of those cards and put it into play tapped under your control. Then your opponent chooses one and puts it into play tapped under his or her control. Repeat this process until all cards set aside this way have been chosen. (Local enchantments with no permanent to enchant remain removed from the game.)

rulings.text: In multi-player games, it affects all players and players make choices in turn order.
An Aura put onto the battlefield this way does not target the permanent it is placed upon.
Triggers from the permanents leaving the battlefield and then being put back onto the battlefield are not put on the stack until the entire effect is done.
You can't pick a card that can't legally be returned to the battlefield. If there are no cards that can be legally returned, then you can't pick one.

If you choose an Aura, you can put it on any permanent it can legally enchant. If there is nothing it can legally enchant, it remains exiled, and it can still be chosen by you or another player later in the auction. If there comes a point where only Auras and no legal permanents left, they stay exiled permanently.

cards.name: Food Chain
cards.text: Exile a creature you control: Add X mana of any one color, where X is 1 plus the exiled creature's converted mana cost. Spend this mana only to cast creature spells.
cards.original_text: Remove a creature you control from the game: Add X mana of any color to your mana pool, where X is the removed creature's converted mana cost plus one. This mana may be spent only to play creature spells.

rulings.text: This mana may not be used to pay costs imposed after the spell is initially cast.
This mana may be used on additional costs to cast the spell, such as Kicker.

cards.text: At the beginning of your upkeep, each player reveals the top card of their library. If all cards revealed this way are creature cards, put those cards onto the battlefield under their owners' control.
cards.original_text: At the beginning of your upkeep, each player reveals the top card of his or her library. If all cards revealed this way are creature cards, put those cards into play under their owners' control. (Otherwise, put them back face-down on top of their owners' libraries.)

cards.name: Invigorate
cards.text:
If you control a Forest, rather than pay this spell's mana cost, you may have an opponent gain 3 life.
Target creature gets +4/+4 until end of turn.
cards.original_text:
If you control a forest, you may have an opponent gain 3 life instead of paying Invigorate's mana cost.
Target creature gets +4/+4 until end of turn.

rulings.text: If another effect causes Invigorate to cost more, you must pay that additional cost even if you pay its alternative cost.

If an effect says that an opponent can't gain life, you can't have that player gain life to pay Invigorate's alternative cost. If an effect instead replaces life gain, such as that of Sulfuric Vortex, you may choose to pay the cost even though the cost's action is replaced with nothing.

cards.name: Lure
cards.text:
Enchant creature
All creatures able to block enchanted creature do so.
cards.flavor: Deepwood's reach is not long, so it invites its enemies in.
cards.original_text: All creatures able to block enchanted creature do so if able.

rulings.text: Lure doesn't give any creatures the ability to block the target creature. It just forces those creatures that are already able to block the creature to do so.

As blockers are declared, any creature that's tapped or affected by a spell or ability that says it can't block doesn't block. If there's a cost associated with having the creature block, no player is forced to pay that cost, so it doesn't block if that cost isn't paid.

rulings.text: A noncreature permanent that turns into a creature can attack, and its {T} abilities can be activated, only if its controller has continuously controlled that permanent since the beginning of their most recent turn. It doesn't matter how long the permanent has been a creature.

cards.name: Crooked Scales
cards.text: {4}, {T}: Flip a coin. If you win the flip, destroy target creature an opponent controls. If you lose the flip, destroy target creature you control unless you pay {3} and repeat this process.
cards.original_text: {4}, {T}: Choose target creature you control and target creature an opponent controls. Flip a coin. If you win the flip, destroy the creature the opponent controls. If you lose the flip, destroy the creature you control unless you pay {3} and reflip the coin.

rulings.text: If you pay the {3}, you do not choose a new pair of targets when it repeats. This means that if you lose the flip, you have the choice of having your creature destroyed or paying {3} to try again to win the flip. If you lose again, you get the same choice, and so on. You can keep trying to destroy your opponent's creature as long as you have mana to pay.
You choose both targets on activation, so you can only activate this when you can legally choose both targets.

cards.name: Mercadian Lift
cards.text:
{1}, {T}: Put a winch counter on Mercadian Lift.
{T}, Remove X winch counters from Mercadian Lift: You may put a creature card with converted mana cost X from your hand onto the battlefield.
cards.original_text:
{1}, {T}: Put a winch counter on Mercadian Lift.
{T}, Remove X winch counters from Mercadian Lift: Put a creature card with converted mana cost X from your hand into play.

rulings.text: Putting the card onto the battlefield is optional. When the ability resolves, you can choose not to.

cards.name: Monkey Cage
cards.text: When a creature enters the battlefield, sacrifice Monkey Cage and create X 2/2 green Monkey creature tokens, where X is that creature's converted mana cost.
cards.original_text: When a creature comes into play, sacrifice Monkey Cage and put into play a number of 2/2 green Ape creature tokens equal to that creature's converted mana cost.

cards.name: Panacea
cards.text: {X}{X}, {T}: Prevent the next X damage that would be dealt to any target this turn.
cards.flavor: A drop numbs the tongue. A sip sends the heart racing. A draught reforges the body.
cards.original_text: {X}{X}, {T}: Prevent the next X damage that would be dealt to target creature or player this turn.

cards.name: Power Matrix
cards.text: {T}: Target creature gets +1/+1 and gains flying, first strike, and trample until end of turn.
cards.flavor: As he repaired the ship's planeswalking engine, Karn saw for the first time how he could catalyze the Weatherlight's evolution.
cards.original_text: {T}: Target creature gets +1/+1 and gains flying, first strike, and trample until end of turn.

cards.name: Puffer Extract
cards.text: {X}, {T}: Target creature you control gets +X/+X until end of turn. Destroy it at the beginning of the next end step.
cards.flavor: The puffer's flesh is the deadliest in the sea—and therefore the most useful.
cards.original_text: {X}, {T}: Target creature you control gets +X/+X until end of turn. Destroy it at end of turn.

cards.name: Rishadan Pawnshop
cards.text: {2}, {T}: Shuffle target nontoken permanent you control into its owner's library.
cards.flavor: Everything comes to the waterfront eventually, on the tide or on credit.
cards.original_text: {2}, {T}: Shuffle target card in play you control into its owner's library.

cards.name: Toymaker
cards.text: {1}, {T}, Discard a card: Target noncreature artifact becomes an artifact creature with power and toughness each equal to its converted mana cost until end of turn. (It retains its abilities.)
cards.original_text: {1}, {T}, Discard a card from your hand: Target noncreature artifact becomes an artifact creature with power and toughness each equal to its converted mana cost until end of turn. (It retains its abilities.)

rulings.text: A noncreature permanent that turns into a creature can attack, and its {T} abilities can be activated, only if its controller has continuously controlled that permanent since the beginning of their most recent turn. It doesn't matter how long the permanent has been a creature.

cards.name: Worry Beads
cards.text: At the beginning of each player's upkeep, that player puts the top card of their library into their graveyard.
cards.original_text: At the beginning of each player's upkeep, that player puts the top card of his or her library into his or her graveyard.
